question: can my 10 Parkun events count toward mu EPA ?if yes , what is the process?
answer:
Yes, you can count this toward your EPA Award!
Please add it under Community Involvement > Ongoing Roles.
You can claim points every 3 months, so if you continue volunteering beyond that, you can submit it again for extra points.

If you haven’t joined the EPA Award yet, you can sign up here: https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/s/epa

question: I booked and appointment with nima at 1:00 pm,but room M 2:09 is closed.where should I go or should I wait outside ? What should I do when the room locked at my appointment time?
answer:
If the room is locked at your appointment time,Call or text the Employability front desk immediately: tel:0800924528 (or the mobile number in your booking confirmation email).
If no one answers within 2 minutes, email mycareer@waikato.ac.nz with your name, student ID.

question: where are the job oppurtunities for someone who has completed a master's a master's in chemist?
answer:
Common job areas for Master's in Chemistry graduates:
R&D chemist / formulation scientist (pharmaceuticals, agrichemicals, specialty polymers)
Analytical/quality control labs (food & beverage, environmental testing, forensic science)
Process/chemical engineering support (dairy, pulp & paper, energy)
Regulatory affairs or HSE roles that need deep technical knowledge
Secondary-school science teaching (with additional teaching qualification)
Crown Research Institutes & government agencies (e.g., EPA, NIWA, GNS)
Next step: book a free 15-minute Career Consultant drop-in to discuss where recent Waikato chemistry alumni are now, how to target your CV and which NZ job boards/graduate programmes open soon. Times & sign-up: https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/students/appointments/app/topic/5?siteId=1

question: How can I get the Employability Plus Award certificate after earning enough points for the Gold award?
answer:
The award automatically tracks your progress. When you complete each section (Community, University, and Employability), you'll receive a certificate for Bronze, Silver, and Gold.
Once you finish the entire award, you'll get a final named certificate. You can also download it anytime from the last section of the award called “Congratulations.”
Please note it may take a few seconds to appear

question: How do to upload my CV on MyWIL?
answer: Once you have your CV, log into your MyWIL account, go to the 'Forms' tab, click 'Edit', and submit the 'CV Review Form'.
